definition: Tubo or Tufan, old name for Tibet/the Tibetan Tubo dynasty 7th-11th century AD/also pr. [Tu3 fan1]
to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)
to vomit/to throw up
luxuriant/flourishing/to reproduce/to proliferate
see 吐蕃[Tu3 bo1]
variant of 番[fan1]/foreign (non-Chinese)
Tibetan Tubo Dynasty 7th-11th century AD

sentences.english: In the late Tianbac period of Tang Dynasty, Beidi served as a major battlefield for Tang and Tufang armies.
sentences.chinese: 天寶後期，北地多次成爲唐軍與吐蕃決戰的主戰場。

sentences.english: With her into the Tubo Kingdom of the waiter, many people are process technicians.
sentences.chinese: 隨她入吐蕃的侍者，不少人是工藝技術人員。

sentences.english: Tubo regime's expansion is the inevitable outcome of militarization system of Tubo regime in earlier stage.
sentences.chinese: 吐蕃東擴是吐蕃王朝前期軍事化體制的必然產物。

sentences.english: Tubo regime's expansion is the inevitable outcome of militarization system of Tubo regime in earlier stage.
sentences.chinese: 吐蕃東擴是吐蕃王朝前期軍事化體制的必然產物。

sentences.english: To the late Tang and Five Dynasties, Zhouqu Tibetan sphere of influence is still habitat.
sentences.chinese: 唐末至五代，舟曲境仍在吐蕃勢力範圍。

sentences.english: Chapter four is explained Japanese red pine Germany praises to the education state that the imperial court of Tibetan regime collapses in period.
sentences.chinese: 第四章闡述赤松德贊到吐蕃王朝崩潰時期的教育狀況。

sentences.english: Was it built during the Tubo Period?
sentences.chinese: 它是吐蕃時期開始創建的嗎？

sentences.english: Dangxiang people migrated to the interior of China under the attack of the Tibetans.
sentences.chinese: 唐朝時期党項族在吐蕃的進攻下不斷向內地遷徙。

sentences.english: There waiting to marry the Tibetan King Songtsan the Tang Dynasty emperor's daughter.
sentences.chinese: 那裏有吐蕃王松贊干布等待迎娶這位唐朝皇帝的女兒。

sentences.english: Tibetan Buddhism that emerged was widely worshipped by the Tubo residents.
sentences.chinese: 藏傳佛教的出現受到廣泛崇拜的吐蕃居民。

sentences.english: In A. D. 1239, Mongolia forces occupied Tubo kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 公元1239年，蒙古軍隊佔領吐蕃王國。

sentences.english: Chapter six introduces the complicated relations among Tubo , Tang dynasty and Nanzhao in southwest china.
sentences.chinese: 第五章論述了吐蕃與其統治下的河隴地區的民族關係。

definition: Turkic ethnic group
Tuyuhun, a Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑 nomadic people/a state in Qinhai in 4th-7th century AD
Huihu, Tang dynasty name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]
Huihe, pre-Tang name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur
Tangut branch of the Qiang 羌 ethnic group/ancient ethnic group who made up the Xixia dynasty 西夏 1038-1227
Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
Nanzhao kingdom 738-937 in southwest China and southeast Asia
Western Xia dynasty 1038-1227 of Tangut people 黨項|党项 occupying modern Ningxia and parts of Gansu and Shaanxi, overthrown by Mongols
ancient Central Asian city state, flourished in first millennium AD, in modern Aksu 阿克蘇地區|阿克苏地区, Xinjiang
Qarluq or Karluk nomadic tribe, a Turkic ethnic minority in ancient times
the Tang dynasty (618-907)
Western Regions (Han Dynasty term for regions beyond Yumen Pass 玉門關|玉门关[Yu4 men2 Guan1])
Outer Mongolia (lit. north of the Gobi Desert)
Anxi county, former name of Guazhou county 瓜州縣|瓜州县[Gua1 zhou1 xian4] in Jiuquan 酒泉[Jiu3 quan2], Gansu
khanate (Mongol state)
old place name (up to Tang), in Hengshan county 橫山縣|横山县, Yulin, Shaanxi
